intro: Micheliella anisata, commonly known as the Aniseleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It often grows in moist, shaded areas and is sometimes found in disturbed soils. Due to its aromatic properties, it has been used historically in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils.
